intro: Chamaesyce barberoana, commonly known as the Barberoana sandwort, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Caryophyllaceae. It is a low-growing perennial that typically forms a dense mat of foliage, with small, rounded leaves arranged in a rosette pattern. The plant produces clusters of tiny, white or pale pink flowers during the spring and summer months. It is native to the Mediterranean region and thrives in well-drained, sandy or gravelly soils. Due to its compact growth and ornamental appeal, it is often cultivated in rock gardens or as a ground cover.
